main event: A silver, dome-shaped object larger than a basketball was observed rising slowly towards the west in Delamero, North Dakota on August 4, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for 44 minutes during the daytime.
The report states that the sighting conformed to the criteria for a weather balloon, and that a balloon was in the area at the time of the sighting.
The director on duty thought the sighting might be of the weather balloon.
There were no attempts made to intercept or identify the object.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with broken clouds.
sighted object: silver, dome-shaped object larger than a basketball
